docTitle.titlePart:
Process Modeling Notations
and Workflow Patterns

front.div:
ABSTRACT
The research work of Wil van der Aalst, Arthur ter Hofstede, Bartek Kiepuszewski, and Alistair Barros has resulted in
the identification of 21 patterns that describe the behavior of business processes. This paper reviews how two
graphical process modeling notations, tShe BPMN Business Process Diagram from the Business Process
Management Initiative (BPMI), and the UML 2.0 Activity Diagram from the Object Management Group (OMG), can
represent the workflow patterns. The solutions of the two notations are compared for technical ability to represent
the patterns as well as their readability.
